description: It's Debatable is an elegant, modern form of debate which involves a team of students working to effectively convince a judge that their side of a resolution is more valid. So here we are with an event to give you a chance to show your strong and effective communication skills. To participate in this event a team of 2 members (compulsory) and ability to assert dominance with facts is required.
rules: No. of rounds:2 -per day 1 round
No. of hours and days required:2 days and per day 2-3 hours
There will be two teams, each consisting of two speakers.
The first speaker for the affirmative side begins. Then, the first speaker for the negative side responds. In this way, the speakers for both sides speak in turn.

Each speaker has a maximum time of one minute. The judge will check the time carefully. He/ she gives a sign when the speaker has 10 seconds to go, and after speaking time is over, the speaker may finish his/her sentence and must then stop. Spare time may not be transferred to another speaker.Interrupting a speaker is forbidden.
Controversial topics should be avoided
Speakers are accepted to use appropriate language. On use of inappropriate language the judges have the authority to disqualify the team
There will be a time limit of 7 mins for each topic so one of the team must conclude so as to complete the debate in the given time limit.
The audience must not participate in the debate.
After the debate, the audience has 3 minutes to share their impressions and opinions in which they can ask questions which are related to any of the members of the teams.
The witness must answer the questions from the audience without consulting his/her members.
The judge will base his/her decision entirely on the material presented, without regard for other material which he may happen to possess and declare the result.

tagLine: Write Code’s that computer can digest
description: Team type(Solo/Group): Solo Group size (if any): - There will be two Rounds in this Event: Round 1: Speed and Accuracy test Questions: 8 questions may vary) Time: 1:30hr Round 2: Challenge yourself Questions: 6 questions (may vary) Time: 1:30 hr.
rules: Ranks will be decided from hackerrank leaderboard and after plagiarism checking.
Top 50% (may vary) from hackerrank leaderboard will be qualified for round 2.
Contest will be held on Hackerrank.
Plagiarism detectors will detect solutions, if found similar codes or copied from other sites
This is a two day event.
We will provide you with a contest link on registered email 2 days prior to contest.
Last decision will be made by the event organizers.

rules: No. of rounds: 1 Group vs 1 group, Knockout matches

tagLine: Have video skills and no project?
description: Team type(Solo/Group): Group Group size (if any): NA
rules: No. of rounds: 1
No. of hours and days required: 3 Days
The two themes are Loneliness and Action. The participant has to choose one among the two.
The participant will be provided with music and footage(worth 20 minutes) on a Google Drive folder.
The final cut must be between 30 to 90 seconds.
Using audio or video from outside will lead to disqualification.
Upon confirmation of your registration, you will be added to a WhatsApp group where you will receive updates and a link to upload your final cut.

tagLine: Use your cameras to click something other than assignments
description: A delicious meal appeals to more of your senses than just smell and taste. It must also appeal to the eye. To encourage creativity and culinary excellence, the participants would have to arrange, garnish and style a dish. The theme is “Your take on Your Meal”. Jazz up your meal in your own unique way, be it the everyday staple or a 5 course menu, make it exciting, adorn it. To achieve a well-plated dish, you must pay attention to the details i.e. the colors, the textures and how everything comes together.
rules: No. of rounds: 1
No. of hours and days required: 3 Days
The two themes are Loneliness and Action. The participant has to choose one among the two.
The participant will be provided with music and footage(worth 20 minutes) on a Google Drive folder.
The final cut must be between 30 to 90 seconds.
Using audio or video from outside will lead to disqualification.
Upon confirmation of your registration, you will be added to a WhatsApp group where you will receive updates and a link to upload your final cut.

description: Participants will have to choose one emotion from the list below. And try to portray the emotion through any of the art forms or performing art. One can use skills like dancing, singing, acting, painting, photography, sketching or something that justifies the emotion. Submit video or photo accordingly. Emotions : Love, Fear, Happiness, Admiration, Excitement, Courage.Team type(Solo/Group): Solo Group size (if any): NA
rules: No. of rounds: 1
No. of hours and days required: Announcement of event to 7th of march 5pm for submission (Not a live event)
Choose only one emotion.
Submission link will be provided on event day.
The video of performing art should not take more than 2 min.
In case we found copyright from some resource, those students will be disqualified.
Judging Criteria: The ability to convey the selected emotion appropriately through the art form

description: Hackathon is the technical event wherein participants have to implement their innovative ideas and develop their projects within stipulated time. This event is designed exclusively for all the students who want to showcase their amazing ideas and projects. The project must be based on any Computer Science relevant technologies.(eg. Web App , Android App , Graphics Project , IoT , ML models, etc). There will be two rounds. In the first round participants have to submit their idea with a project report or presentation. In the final round selected teams will have to implement their ideas in a given amount of time followed by a final presentation. Evaluation will also be done in specified time intervals similar to normal offline hackathons. Team type(Solo/Group): Group Group size (if any): max 4
rules: No. of rounds: 2
Judging Criteria: Evaluation Rounds conducted during online hackathon
Deadlines should be followed strictly.
Standard Report Format provided should be strictly followed.
All the intermediate evaluation processes during 24 hrs Online
Hackathon should be followed.
All the group members should be present during the final online presentation.
The results and winners identified by judges will be final and non-negotiable under any conditions.
No. of rounds: 2
No. of rounds: 2
No. of hours and days required: 2 hours, 1 day
Judging Criteria: Evaluation based on the solution submitted by the participant.
Participants will be gathered in a meet and will be informed about the platform and also demo would be provided.
Round 1 will consist of 5 questions consisting of 5 codes. Participants have to guess the problem statement according to the given code and have to mention what the output 0 and 1 indicates.
Eg. 0 means even and 1 means odd
Round 2: There would be two types of questions:
Type 1:Fix the code, that is debug it
Type 2: Find the missing lines.
Total questions would be 5.
Marks would be given only if the code has been properly fixed that is running properly, else zero marks would be given.

Decisions made by organizers will be final.
